docs.lead_paragraph: An evangelist preacher is calling for a boycott of the upcoming Walt Disney film "Beauty and the Beast" because it features a gay character, saying that the company is trying to promote an LGBT agenda to children.

headline.main: 'Beauty and Beast' Gay Character Sparks Christian Boycott Calls
headline.print_headline: 'Beauty and Beast' Gay Character Sparks Christian Boycott Calls

docs.snippet: An evangelist preacher is calling for a boycott of the upcoming Walt Disney film "Beauty and the Beast" because it features a gay character, saying that the company is trying to promote an LGBT agenda to children....

docs.lead_paragraph: Long-running hearings for whether a giant telescope can be built atop a Hawaii mountain have wrapped up. But it will be a while before a decision is made on a project that has prompted intense protests by those who believe it will desecrate sacred land.

headline.main: After 44 Days, Hearings End for Giant Telescope in Hawaii
headline.print_headline: After 44 Days, Hearings End for Giant Telescope in Hawaii

docs.lead_paragraph: Ride services company Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] for years has used a secret tool to avoid authorities in markets where its service faced resistance by law enforcement or was banned, the company confirmed on Friday.

headline.main: Uber Used Secret Tool to Evade Authorities
headline.print_headline: Uber Used Secret Tool to Evade Authorities

docs.snippet: Ride services company Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] for years has used a secret tool to avoid authorities in markets where its service faced resistance by law enforcement or was banned, the company confirmed on Friday....

docs.lead_paragraph: Georgia, responding to an intervention from a European court, on Friday suspended a ruling from a domestic court that had placed the country's biggest independent TV station under the control of a close ally of the government.

headline.main: Georgia Suspends Ownership Change for Broadcaster After Euro Court Ruling
headline.print_headline: Georgia Suspends Ownership Change for Broadcaster After Euro Court Ruling

docs.snippet: Georgia, responding to an intervention from a European court, on Friday suspended a ruling from a domestic court that had placed the country's biggest independent TV station under the control of a close ally of the government....

docs.lead_paragraph: An Alabama drive-in theater won't show a new re-telling of the classic fairy tale "Beauty and the Beast" because one of its characters is portrayed as homosexual.

headline.main: Gay Moment Nixes 'Beauty and the Beast' at Alabama Drive-In
headline.print_headline: Gay Moment Nixes 'Beauty and the Beast' at Alabama Drive-In

docs.lead_paragraph: Janet L. Yellen, the chairwoman of the Federal Reserve, said that the Fed plans to raise its benchmark interest rates this month if conditions are favorable.

docs.lead_paragraph: Answers Corp [AFCVHA.UL], which owns the Answers.com and Multiply websites, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Friday with a plan to swap ownership of the company to creditors who are owed about $540 million, according to court documents.

headline.main: Answers Corp Files for Bankruptcy to Cut $471 Million in Debt
headline.print_headline: Answers Corp Files for Bankruptcy to Cut $471 Million in Debt

docs.lead_paragraph: A former district attorney investigator in Texas has been convicted of stealing more than $1 million in collectible comic books and sports memorabilia that were being held as evidence in a criminal case.

headline.main: Texas Man Convicted of Stealing Comic Books Held as Evidence
headline.print_headline: Texas Man Convicted of Stealing Comic Books Held as Evidence
